title: Nearshore Underwater Target Detection Meets UAV-borne Hyperspectral Remote Sensing: A Novel Hybrid-level Contrastive Learning Framework and Benchmark Dataset
author: Jiahao Qi (National University of Defense Technology), Chuanhong Zhou (National University of Defense Technology), Xingyue Liu (National University of Defense Technology), Chen Chen (National University of Defense Technology), Dehui Zhu (National University of Defense Technology), Kangcheng Bin (National University of Defense Technology), Ping Zhong (National University of Defense Technology)
background: The task involves detecting underwater objects using hyperspectral imagery captured by UAVs, which presents unique challenges due to light absorption and scattering in water.
contribution: This paper introduces the Hyperspectral Underwater Contrastive Learning Network (HUCLNet) to solve challenges in underwater target detection, achieving improved detection accuracy in complex nearshore environments.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods depend heavily on bathymetric models and may struggle with spectral variability caused by underwater conditions, limiting their effectiveness.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by employing a hybrid-level contrastive learning approach, integrating reliability-guided clustering and self-paced learning strategies to enhance target characterization.

key_innovation: Introduces a self-paced learning paradigm that progressively refines feature representations, enhancing the discriminative power of the detection algorithm in challenging underwater conditions.
real_world_impact: The proposed framework and benchmark dataset could greatly improve the dynamics of underwater monitoring and environmental assessments, aiding in resource management and ecosystem conservation.
limitations: No limitations are explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.contrastive learning: **Contrastive learning** is a technique in machine learning where the model learns to distinguish between similar and dissimilar examples, enhancing feature representation.
new_terms.self-paced learning: **Self-paced learning** gradually incorporates data samples based on their difficulty to improve model training stability and effectiveness.

open_sourcing: The dataset and code will be publicly available at: https://github.com/qjh1996/HUTD
